t: Awake,*p awake; put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city: for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.
Shake*p thyself from the dust; arise, and sit down, O Jerusalem: loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.
For*p thus saith the Lord,*s Ye have sold yourselves for nought; and ye shall be redeemed without money.
For*p thus saith the Lord God,*s My people went down aforetime into Egypt to sojourn there; and the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.

Now*p therefore, what have I here, saith the Lord,*s that my people is taken away for nought? they that rule over them make them to howl, saith the Lord;*s and my name continually every day is blasphemed.
Therefore*p my people shall know my name: therefore they shall know in that day that I am he that doth speak: behold, it is I.

How*p beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace; that bringeth good tidings of good, that publisheth salvation; that saith unto Zion, Thy God reigneth!
Thy*p watchmen shall lift up the voice; with the voice together shall they sing: for they shall see eye to eye, when the Lord*s shall bring again Zion.
Break*p forth into joy, sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem: for the Lord*s hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem.
The*p Lord*s hath made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God.
Depart*p ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch no unclean thing; go ye out of the midst of her; be ye clean, that bear the vessels of the Lord.*s
For*p ye shall not go out with haste, nor go by flight: for the Lord*s will go before you; and the God of Israel will be your rearward.
Behold,*p my servant shall deal prudently, he shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.
As*p many were astonished at thee; his visage was so marred more than any man, and his form more than the sons of men:
So*p shall he sprinkle many nations; the kings shall shut their mouths at him: for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which they had not heard shall they consider.
